intro: Ligusticum meoides, commonly known as meadow parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbrella-like clusters. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Ligusticum meoides thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
